lead_paragraph: LANGE--Patricia Fogelman, Ph.D.,died peacefully at the age of 76 on May 26, 2016. Born in Brooklyn, NY to Betty and Jack Mass, she is survived by her children Melissa (Scott) Siegel, Jonathan (Jill) Fogelman and brother Mitchell (Alice) Mass; her grandchildren Samantha and Jake, her nieces and nephews, Erik, Laura, Noah, Myra, Maya, Griffin; stepchildren Fred (Claudia) Lange and family, Richard (Chris) Lange, David (Carrie) Lange and dog Remy. Pat received her Ph.D. in Art Education from New York University with focus on Pueblo Pottery Figurines. In pursuit of her lifelong passion, she relocated to Santa Fe more than 25 years ago to continue her research in Native American art. There she married Charles H. Lange (deceased). Her art work was exhibited on numerous occasions. She was the author of two books, and is a quoted authority by other authors and scholars. A Wenner-Gren Foundation Grant winner and member of the Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society, Pat was also a co-curator for a show at the Wheelwright Museum of the American Indians in Santa Fe, an Adjunct Instructor at the Santa Fe Community College, Scholar in Residence at the Institute of American Indians and a Research Associate at the Museum of New Mexico, Laboratory of Anthropology/ Museum of Indian Arts and Culture. Donations in her memory may be made to the Patricia Fogelman Lange Memorial Endowed Scholarship at Santa Fe Community College Foundation, 6401 Richards Avenue, Santa Fe, NM 87508. Forever bringing beauty and color to all around, she will be greatly missed and always in our hearts. 1/3
